definition.description: Hue white and color ambiance E26/E27

features.description: Color temperature after cold power on of this light
features.label: Color temp startup
features.name: color_temp_startup

presets.description: Restore previous color_temp on cold power on
presets.name: previous

features.description: Color of this light in the CIE 1931 color space (x/y)
features.label: Color (X/Y)
features.name: color_xy

features.description: Color of this light expressed as hue/saturation
features.label: Color (HS)
features.name: color_hs

exposes.description: Controls the behavior when the device is powered on after power loss
exposes.label: Power-on behavior
exposes.name: power_on_behavior

options.description: Controls the transition time (in seconds) of on/off, brightness, color temperature (if applicable) and color (if applicable) changes. Defaults to `0` (no transition).
options.label: Transition
options.name: transition

options.description: When enabled colors will be synced, e.g. if the light supports both color x/y and color temperature a conversion from color x/y to color temperature will be done when setting the x/y color (default true).
options.label: Color sync
options.name: color_sync

options.description: State actions will also be published as 'action' when true (default false).
options.label: State action
options.name: state_action

options.description: State actions will also be published as 'action' when true (default false).
options.label: State action
options.name: state_action

exposes.description: Remaining battery in %, can take up to 24 hours before reported.
exposes.label: Battery
exposes.name: battery

exposes.description: Voltage of the battery in millivolts
exposes.label: Voltage
exposes.name: voltage

exposes.description: Number of power outages (since last pairing)
exposes.label: Power outage count
exposes.name: power_outage_count

options.description: Calibrates the device_temperature value (absolute offset), takes into effect on next report of device.
options.label: Device temperature calibration
options.name: device_temperature_calibration

options.description: Set to false to disable the legacy integration (highly recommended), will change structure of the published payload (default true).
options.label: Legacy
options.name: legacy

exposes.description: Remaining battery in %, can take up to 24 hours before reported.
exposes.label: Battery
exposes.name: battery

exposes.description: Voltage of the battery in millivolts
exposes.label: Voltage
exposes.name: voltage

definition.description: Aqara human body movement and illuminance sensor

exposes.description: Remaining battery in %, can take up to 24 hours before reported.
exposes.label: Battery
exposes.name: battery

exposes.description: Indicates whether the device detected occupancy
exposes.label: Occupancy
exposes.name: occupancy

exposes.description: Voltage of the battery in millivolts
exposes.label: Voltage
exposes.name: voltage

options.description: Calibrates the device_temperature value (absolute offset), takes into effect on next report of device.
options.label: Device temperature calibration
options.name: device_temperature_calibration

options.description: Calibrates the illuminance_lux value (percentual offset), takes into effect on next report of device.
options.label: Illuminance lux calibration
options.name: illuminance_lux_calibration

options.description: Calibrates the illuminance value (percentual offset), takes into effect on next report of device.
options.label: Illuminance calibration
options.name: illuminance_calibration

options.description: Time in seconds after which occupancy is cleared after detecting it (default 90 seconds).
options.label: Occupancy timeout
options.name: occupancy_timeout

options.description: Sends a message the last time occupancy (occupancy: true) was detected. When setting this for example to [10, 60] a `{"no_occupancy_since": 10}` will be send after 10 seconds and a `{"no_occupancy_since": 60}` after 60 seconds.
options.label: No occupancy since
options.name: no_occupancy_since

definition.description: Aqara temperature, humidity and pressure sensor

exposes.description: Remaining battery in %, can take up to 24 hours before reported.
exposes.label: Battery
exposes.name: battery

exposes.description: Voltage of the battery in millivolts
exposes.label: Voltage
exposes.name: voltage

options.description: Calibrates the temperature value (absolute offset), takes into effect on next report of device.
options.label: Temperature calibration
options.name: temperature_calibration

options.description: Number of digits after decimal point for temperature, takes into effect on next report of device. This option can only decrease the precision, not increase it.
options.label: Temperature precision
options.name: temperature_precision

options.description: Calibrates the humidity value (absolute offset), takes into effect on next report of device.
options.label: Humidity calibration
options.name: humidity_calibration

options.description: Number of digits after decimal point for humidity, takes into effect on next report of device. This option can only decrease the precision, not increase it.
options.label: Humidity precision
options.name: humidity_precision

options.description: Calibrates the pressure value (absolute offset), takes into effect on next report of device.
options.label: Pressure calibration
options.name: pressure_calibration

options.description: Number of digits after decimal point for pressure, takes into effect on next report of device. This option can only decrease the precision, not increase it.
options.label: Pressure precision
options.name: pressure_precision

exposes.description: Remaining battery in %, can take up to 24 hours before reported.
exposes.label: Battery
exposes.name: battery

options.description: Simulate a brightness value. If this device provides a brightness_move_up or brightness_move_down action it is possible to specify the update interval and delta. The action_brightness_delta indicates the delta for each interval.
options.label: Simulated brightness
options.name: simulated_brightness

exposes.description: Controls the behavior when the device is powered on after power loss
exposes.label: Power-on behavior
exposes.name: power_on_behavior

options.description: Controls the transition time (in seconds) of on/off, brightness, color temperature (if applicable) and color (if applicable) changes. Defaults to `0` (no transition).
options.label: Transition
options.name: transition

options.description: State actions will also be published as 'action' when true (default false).
options.label: State action
options.name: state_action

exposes.description: Voltage of the battery in millivolts
exposes.label: Voltage

options.description: Calibrates the device_temperature value (absolute offset), takes into effect on next report of device.

exposes.label: Voltage
exposes.name: voltage

options.description: Calibrates the device_temperature value (absolute offset), takes into effect on next report of device.
options.label: Device temperature calibration
options.name: device_temperature_calibration

options.description: Set to false to disable the legacy integration (highly recommended), will change structure of the published payload (default true).
options.label: Legacy
options.name: legacy

exposes.description: Remaining battery in %, can take up to 24 hours before reported.
exposes.label: Battery
exposes.name: battery

exposes.description: Voltage of the battery in millivolts
exposes.label: Voltage
exposes.name: voltage

options.description: The WXKG01LM only reports a button press and release.By default, a hold action is published when there is at least 1000 ms between both events. It could be that due to delays in the network the release message is received late. This causes a single click to be identified as a hold action. If you are experiencing this you can try experimenting with this option (e.g. set it to 2000) (value is in ms).
options.label: Hold timeout
options.name: hold_timeout

options.description: Sometimes it happens that the button does not send a release. To avoid problems a release is automatically send after a timeout. The default timeout is 4000 ms, you can increase it with this option (value is in ms).
options.label: Hold timeout expire
options.name: hold_timeout_expire

options.description: Set to false to disable the legacy integration (highly recommended), will change structure of the published payload (default true).
options.label: Legacy
options.name: legacy

options.description: State actions will also be published as 'action' when true (default false).
options.label: State action
options.name: state_action

options.description: State actions will also be published as 'action' when true (default false).
options.label: State action
options.name: state_action
